Directory history, stack or similar feat: yes (CDPATH, pushd, popd, dirs), CDPATH since SVr4

Wildcardcompletion: yesAlt-Shift-8 or Alt-* will expand to the full matching list of filenames.

Directory history, stack or similar feat: Yes (cdpath builtin, pushd, popd implemented as functions)

Automaticsuggestions: Yes (via predict-on or user-definede.g. via 3rd party such as zsh-autosuggestions)
Syntaxhighlighting: Third-party extensionzsh does not feature syntax highlighting, but a 3rd party project exists which offers this capability as an add-on: zsh-syntax-highlighting

Commandhistory: noAvailable through the DOSKEY add-on.Available in DR-DOS through HISTORY.
Menu/optionsprompt: no (onlyviaexternal CHOICE command, in DR-DOS also via SWITCH/ DRSWITCH internal commands)

Commandhistory: yesAlternatively available through the DOSKEY add-on as well.Alternatively available in DR-DOS through HISTORY as well.
Directory history, stack or similar feat: (via popup, extended directory searches, CDPATH, PUSHD, POPD, DIRHISTORY, DIRS, CDD, CD- commands and %@DIRSTACK[] function)
Valueprompt: yes (via INPUT, INKEY and ESET commands)
Menu/optionsprompt: yes (via @SELECT[] function, and indirectly via a combination of INKEY, INPUT, SWITCH commands)
Commandbuilder: no (exceptfor OPTION command for INI file directives)

Directory history, stack or similar feat: (via popup, extended directory searches, CDPATH, PUSHD, POPD, DIRHISTORY, DIRS, CDD, CD- commands and %@DIRSTACK[] function)
Valueprompt: yes (via INPUT, INKEY, ESET and SET /P commands)
Menu/optionsprompt: yes (via @SELECT[] function, and indirectly via a combination of INKEY, INPUT, SWITCH commands)TCC has special prompt functions for Yes, No, Cancel, Close, Retry.

Syntaxhighlighting: yes2Yes, in ISE and PSReadLine module (included in v5.0)
Directory history, stack or similar feat: Yes, multiple stacks, multiple location typesPush-Location (with alias pushd) and Pop-Location (with alias popd) allows multiple location types (directories of file systems, organizational units of Active Directory, nodes of Windows Registry etc) to be pushed onto and popped from location stacks.
Menu/optionsprompt: yesThe $host.ui.PromptForChoice function allows for a menu-style prompt for choices. The prompt works from background jobs as well as from remote sessions, displaying the menu prompt on the console of the controlling session.
Progressindicator: yesThe Write-Progress cmdlet writes a progress bar which can indicate percentage, remaining seconds etc. The progress bar messages work from background jobs or remote sessions in addition to interactive scripts, i.e. the progress bar is displayed on the console of the controlling session, not as part of the regular output.
Commandbuilder: popup windowThe Show-Command cmdlet inspects the command definition and opens an interactive windows with a named input field for each parameter/switch

Commandnamecompletion: yesHandled by rio, GNU readline, editline or vrl.

Commandargumentcompletion: when defined or parsable in man pages
Integratedenvironment: yesThe fish shell is an interactive character based input/output surface.
